title: Mamata Banerjee’s absence from NITI Aayog meet draws flak from Opposition

title: Not a favour, but a responsibility: Delhi High Court on child maintenance

title: Emergence of new COVID variants detected in India
content: Indian SARS-CoV-2 Genomics Consortium (INSACOG) data shows detection of COVID-19 variants NB.1.8.1 and LF.7 in India, driving rise in cases in Asia

title: Supreme Court sets aside life imprisonment in murder case on grounds of insanity
content: A Bench of Justice A.S. Oka, who retired on May 24, said the medical check on the man, Dashrath Patra, was conducted five years after the crime and thus “meaningless”

title: Trinamool rallies behind Abhishek Banerjee’s call to restore Rash Behari Bose Memorial in Tokyo

content: Minister distributes offer letters to candidates during the mega job fair organised in Nagercoil; six job fairs were organised in recent months to give opportunities to youth in Kanniyakumari district, says Minister

title: Bengal teachers plan to intensify protests if government ‘fails to meet deadline’
content: They have sought an audience with the State Education Minister and say they will wait for a response till Monday. They say they will start writing to MPs across party lines urging them to address their issue in Parliament

title: Politics of the palm: A protest wrapped in a festival in Tamil Nadu
content: At Narasinganur village in Villupuram district, toddy tappers from across the State gathered to celebrate the palm tree in all its glory. This day-long festival may seem like a joyride on the outside but in it exists an underlying protest

title: West Bengal government bans 137 medicines
content: This comes as the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation found over 196 substandard drugs across India

title: Monsoon arrives in Kerala ahead of schedule
content: India Meteorological Department confirmed arrival of the monsoon three days before its forecast of May 27

title: Twin flyovers to flank Edappally by 2025 end
content: Vehicles waiting at the bottlenecked junction will be rerouted through underpasses of two flyovers under construction since early this year on the junction’s northern and southern sides, according to the National Highway Authority of India’s plan

title: Andhra Pradesh hands over Civil Supplies building to Telangana
content: Civil Supplies Ministers of both the States discuss key issues at a meeting in Hyderabad; 16 flats in Shanti Shikhar Apartments also being allotted to Telangana

title: Heavy rain: DDMA holds meeting to review safety arrangements in Kozhikode
content: Instructions issued to village-level rescue squads to remain prepared to meet rain-related calamities and arrange facilities in advance to address relocation requirements

title: Kambalakonda Eco-Tourism Park: Visakhapatnam’s green retreat with cottages, wildlife and thrills
content: A scenic transformation is underway at Kambalakonda Eco Tourism Park with upgraded trails, cottages and renewed focus on biodiversity

title: HC orders DGP to take action against police officers interfering in civil dispute
content: The court says the ADSP issued a notice under Sections 91 and 160 of the Cr.PC. Issuance of summons under these Sections arises only after the case is registered

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan objects to film bodies’ ‘disrespectful attitude’
content: The government will henceforth engage with representatives of the film associations only and not at the individual level, he asserts

title: 'Victims Of Pak Terrorism Predominantly Civilians': Indian Envoy At UN
content: India's Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Ambassador Parvathaneni Harish, strongly criticized Pakistan's actions at the UN Security Council Open Debate on Protection of Civilians in Armed Conflict.

title: "In Love, Have Been In Relationship For 12 Years": Tej Pratap Yadav
content: Former Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav on Saturday said he was "in a relationship" with a young woman, prompting netizens to recall his marital dispute that made headlines a few years ago.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Are Tomatoes Selling So Cheap? A Much Bigger Problem Is At Play
content: Tomatoes are aplenty and selling cheap this summer across India, and, as they say, there is a problem of plenty, thanks to crop rotation, hybrid seeds and nature's bounty.

title: Most COVID Cases In India Mild, Under Home Care: Sources
content: Most of the Covid cases reported in various states are mild in nature and the patients are under home care, official sources said amid a rise in cases in some countries.

title: Opinion: Opinion: The Mysore Sandal Dilemma: Local Pride vs The 'Pan-India' Myth
content: The Tamannaah-Mysore Sandal Soap saga is far more than just the latest celebrity endorsement to draw flak.

title: Cannes, Parts Of Southern France Suffer Major Power Outage, Probe Underway
content: French police were investigating a possible arson attack as being the main cause for a power outage which hit the Alpes-Maritimes region in southern France on Saturday, including Cannes which is hosting its world-famous annual film festival.

title: Monsoon Arrives Early In Kerala, IMD Warns Of Heavy Rains Across India
content: The Southwest Monsoon has arrived over Kerala on Saturday, nearly a week ahead of the usual onset date of June 1, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: "It's Not A Conflict In Kashmir": S Jaishankar On India-Pak Clash
content: The recent confrontation between India and Pakistan was not a "conflict in Kashmir", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar asserted, saying such a description would be like putting the perpetrator and the victim of the Pahalgam attack at same level.

title: Kerala Man Charged For "Brutally Assaulting" 8-Year-Old Daughter
content: Police booked a man on Saturday after disturbing visuals of him "brutally assaulting" his eight-year-old daughter went viral on social media recently.

title: Central Funds, Water: Non-BJP Chief Ministers' Demands At Meet Led By PM
content: The Niti Aayog meeting on Saturday, in which the Prime Minister urged all states to work together towards the goal of a developed India, also saw some opposition chief ministers raise issues affecting their states, with their main grievances boiling

title: ISRO Rocket Fails 7 Minutes Into Flight, National Panel Set Up To Find Out Why
content: ISRO could not accomplish the launch of a key Earth observation satellite on Sunday after the rocket carrying it, the workhorse PSLV-C61, failed mid-air, less than seven minutes after it took off.

title: Woman Commits Suicide In UP While On Video Call With Husband: Cops
content: A 28-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide here while on a video call with her husband, who is currently working in Saudi Arabia, an official said.

title: Drug Bust Near Delhi University Area Leads To Arrest Of Supplier, 4 Others
content: In an anti-drugs operation near Delhi University's North Campus, a medicine shop owner, a medical representative and three others were arrested for supplying pharmaceutical drugs without any bill or prescription, a Delhi Police official said.

title: CBI Cop Attacked By Ex-Railway Gangman With Bow-Arrow Outside Lucknow Office
content: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) with the CBI was attacked by a former railway gangman with a bow and arrow outside the agency's office in Hazratganj here following which the accused was arrested, police said on Saturday.

title: Court Issues Non-Bailable Warrant Against Rahul Gandhi In Defamation Case
content: The MP-MLA Special Court in Chaibasa, Jharkhand, has issued a non-bailable warrant against senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with a 2018 defamation case.

title: Pregnant Woman, 23, Dies At Jaipur Hospital Due To Suspected Blood Mismatch
content: A 23-year-old pregnant woman died at a Jaipur hospital, with her family claiming that she was transfused with incompatible blood.

title: Man Hung Upside Down, Thrashed In Rajasthan, "Mafia Rule", Says Congress
content: A man was hung upside down with a rope from an earthmover in Beawar district and beaten over the suspicion of cement theft, police on Saturday said.

title: "He Didn't Say He'll Leave": Muhammad Yunus' Aide Amid Resignation Buzz
content: This announcement comes two days after he told student-led National Citizen Party (NCP) leaders that he was mulling resignation as he felt "the situation is such that he cannot work".

title: British-Indian Twins Join High IQ Mensa Club For Brainiacs
content: A pair of British Indian twins have been admitted to the elite Mensa membership club of children with a high intelligence quotient (IQ) after clearing a tough set of challenges to score in the top percentile.

title: X faces outage, users unable to access platform
content: Elon Musk-owned X (formerly Twitter) faces major outage affecting users in India, U.S., and Canada, as reported by Downdetector

title: NH 66 works: protests gain momentum on Edappally-Kodungalloor stretch
content: Protests have revived after newly developed NH 66 corridors in north Kerala developed cracks in several places over the past few days

title: Kerala braces for dengue, leptospirosis outbreaks as monsoon season arrives
content: Seasonal epidemics of dengue fever and leptospirosis outbreaks during monsoon months has been a regular feature in the State since the past several decades

title: Assam’s Nagshankar becomes model temple for turtle conservation
content: ‘Kaso Mitras’ or community turtle guardians were acknowledged for their contributions to the conservation of the reptiles

content: This initiative plays a pivotal role in the development of MSMEs as drivers of self-reliance, innovation and job creation: Kondapalli Srinivas

content: Alok Kumar has alleged that a fresh inquiry is ‘designed solely to create artificial hurdle in his career progression’ when he is due for promotion as DGP

title: Overlooked fallen electric post claims motorist’s life at Kumbalam
content: Residents accused the KSEB of negligence for improperly erecting the support post meant to draw supply wires and the police of overlooking the fallen post

title: Workshop imparts life skills to girls
content: 38 students from 10 government schools in five villages in Alappuzha take part in Girl Empowerment Mission (GEM) workshop

title: Government committed to development of stadium in every district, says Minister Bharath
content: Industries and Commerce Minister, along with ACA president and Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath, Kurnool MP B. Nagaraju and others inspect the ACA cricket ground coming up at Munagalapadu village in Kurnool

title: BRS ridicules Irrigation Minister’s repeated attempt to malign Kaleshwaram project with lies
content: Harish Rao questions Congress govt. why it had not constructed Tummidihatti Barrage, gravity canal to Yellampally from 2007 to 2014

title: District-level anti-drug campaign concludes in Thrissur
content: The Statewide anti-drugs rally, which began in Kasaragod on May 5, is scheduled to conclude in Malappuram on May 26

content: Funds were not released because some States had not signed the memorandum of understanding with the Centre for implementing the PM Schools for Rising India scheme, he charged

title: Orange alert: Dharwad district sets up helpline
content: With orange alert being sounded for Dharwad district, the administration has taken all precautionary measures to address any contingency and has also set up helplines for the purpose.

title: Kozhikode gets official flower, bird, animal and tree
content: It follows constitution of expert committees and studies by biodiversity management committees at the local level which collected opinion from the people

title: Kerala requisitions Centre for nine NDRF teams, given the intensifying monsoon
content: Government hopes to position them strategically across the State along with the police, and fire and rescue departments, revenue teams and voluntary rescue forces

title: Rain, strong winds in Western Ghats disrupt power supply, damage crops in southern districts
content: The well-marked low pressure area over east-central Arabian Sea, off the South Konkan coast, has intensified into a depression; rain lashes Kanniyakumari, Tirunelveli and Tenkasi districts

title: National Farmers’ Party launched in Kottayam, banking on Catholic electorate’s support
content: The Kerala Farmers’ Federation’s political outfit is hoping to ride on rural discontent and agricultural concerns. Former Kanjirappally MLA George J. Mathew will serve as the party chairman.

title: Hundred & 3: Djokovic 3rd man to win 100 titles
content: Novak Djokovic wins Geneva Open to become third man in the Open era to claim 100 singles championships, joining Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer.

title: Coward forgoes Duke, to remain in NBA draft
content: Cedric Coward is keeping his name in the 2025 NBA draft and will forgo the opportunity to play at Duke next season, he told ESPN.

title: Sunderland's 95th-minute goal seals EPL return
content: Sunderland staged a remarkable comeback to beat Sheffield United 2-1 in the Championship playoff final and return to the Premier League after seven years.

title: Cora: Bregman moving closer to possible IL stint
content: Red Sox third baseman Alex Bregman could be nearing a trip to the injured list after leaving Friday's game with right quadriceps tightness, manager Alex Cora said.

title: Panthers' Reinhart out for Game 3 vs. Hurricanes
content: Panthers forward Sam Reinhart will miss Game 3 of the Eastern Conference finals with a lower body injury.

title: Skenes on trade chatter: 'Anybody can play GM'
content: Paul Skenes didn't hear Pirates GM Ben Cherington say that trading him to give the club an influx of position player talent is "not at all part of the conversation." When someone relayed Cherington's comments to him, the 22-year-old ace laughed.

title: Norris sets track record to claim Monaco pole
content: Lando Norris beat Ferrari's Charles Leclerc to pole position at the Monaco Grand Prix in a tense qualifying session that saw the McLaren driver set a new track record.

content: We awarded superlatives for a spring college football transfer portal window that saw Tennessee and UCLA swap quarterbacks, among other intriguing moves.

content: Follow live as the Breanna Stewart and the New York Liberty take on Caitlin Clark and the Indiana Fever on the road.

content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

content: Lapping the streets of Monaco, one is left with a common feeling within F1: This place is holding cars back.

content: With the Canes down in a 2-0 hole, here are the key series stats, players, matchups and betting intel to know.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Commanders hoping Deebo, Tunsil, draft picks will keep Jayden Daniels ascending
content: Washington believes veteran additions Samuel, Tunsil and draft picks at OT, WR will bring different dynamic to offense.

title: Is Betts poised to pass Trout as best player of their generation? Let's find out
content: Mookie Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Mike Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: Which NBA Finals matchup is most compelling? We're ranking all four possible series
content: No matter which two teams escape the conference finals, we're headed for a never-before-seen Finals matchup.

title: Congratulations, you've been promoted to the Premier League! Now what?
content: The past six teams to come up to the Premier League have gone straight back down. How can Leeds, Burnley and Sunderland break that cycle next season?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: Napoli edge out Inter to win 4th Serie A title
content: Napoli clinched their second Serie A title in three seasons after edging Inter Milan thanks to a 2-0 home victory over Cagliari in a dramatic finale to the season on Friday.

title: Klopp on booing TAA: So upset I turned off TV
content: Jurgen Kopp has expressed his disappointment with Liverpool fans booing Trent Alexander-Arnold after the defender announced he will leave the club this summer.

title: Napoli hero McTominay wins Serie A MVP award
content: Scott McTominay proved there's plenty of life after Manchester United, after ending his first season since leaving Old Trafford with a Serie A title and the league's MVP award.

title: Inter focus on UCL 'dream' as Serie A slips away
content: As Inter Milan came to terms with losing the Serie A title on the final day, the tea's assistant coach said they must now shift focus to the Champions League final against PSG

title: Ancelotti after Madrid exit sealed: Bond is 'eternal'
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave Real Madrid after this weekend's final game of the LaLiga season, the club has confirmed.

title: Sources: Garnacho set for Man Utd transfer talks
content: Alejandro Garnacho is increasingly likely to leave Manchester United this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: NWSL's DeMelo reveals she has hyperthyroidism
content: Savannah DeMelo was diagnosed with Graves' disease and hyperthyroidism last fall, conditions she spoke about publicly for the first time this week with ESPN.

title: Ronaldo sells stake in Valladolid following protests
content: Brazil great Ronaldo is selling his controlling stake in Valladolid, the Spanish soccer club said on Friday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Maignan to replace Onana
content: Manchester United are targeting AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan to usurp André Onana as No. 1. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: Southwest monsoon brings relief to Kerala, but strong winds cause damage in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: 'Unity needed to stop return of authoritarianism': B'desh govt fears uncertain future
content: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, faces mounting pressure as rival parties protest, demanding early elections. The government assures democratic reforms before the scheduled 2026 elections, while accusing critics of hindering its progress with unreasonable demands. Concerns rise about potential military intervention, reminiscent of a past crisis, as the army chief supports the opposition's call for elections by December.

title: Container ship capsizes off Kerala coast; 21 crew members rescued
content: A Liberia-flagged container ship, MSC ELSA 3, capsized near Kochi after leaving Vizhinjam port. The Indian Coast Guard launched a major rescue. Twenty-one crew members were rescued from liferafts. The captain and two engineers stayed onboard for salvage. Authorities are monitoring for hazardous materials and potential environmental damage. Efforts are underway to stabilize the vessel and assess risks.

title: Bihar CM and NDA ally Nitish Kumar skips Niti Aayog meet, sparks political buzz
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's absence from the 10th Niti Aayog meeting, along with other opposition-ruled states, has sparked political speculation, especially before PM Modi's Bihar visit. The meeting, focused on 'Viksit Rajya for Viksit Bharat@2047', saw PM Modi advocating for Centre-state collaboration and future-ready cities. While some leaders skipped, PM Modi emphasized 'Team India' for development and promoted tourism.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: Defence push: Naidu pitches Andhra for HAL to make combat aircraft
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has proposed relocating HAL's AMCA and LCA production to his state, offering 10,000 acres. This is part of a larger plan to establish a defence industrial corridor across Andhra Pradesh, aiming to boost domestic production and reduce import dependency.

title: ‘Whitewashing terrorism’: BJP slams Rahul for calling Pak shelling a 'tragedy'
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's description of the Poonch attack as a "tragedy," accusing him of downplaying terrorism. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged Gandhi was "whitewashing" Pakistan's actions and providing them "cover fire." Gandhi, during his visit to Poonch, met with affected families, expressing his commitment to raising their concerns nationally after the cross-border shelling.

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work after retirement: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: ‘Monitoring situation closely’: Top government officials meet after Covid uptick
content: Amid a recent uptick in COVID-19 cases, the Union health secretary convened a review meeting, emphasizing proactive monitoring through existing surveillance systems. While most cases are mild and managed at home, the Delhi government has issued advisories for hospitals to ensure preparedness.

title: 'Pak put in abeyance goodwill ...': MEA on why India suspended Indus Treaty
content: India has justified its decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty, citing Pakistan's violation of the agreement's principles following the Pahalgam terror attack. The Ministry of External Affairs highlighted Pakistan's disregard for goodwill and friendship, coupled with cross-border terrorism hindering India's treaty exploitation. Shifts in ground realities, including climate change and engineering advancements, necessitate renegotiation for the 21st century.

title: India Test squad for England tour: Five burning questions
content: Shubman Gill, 25, has been named India's Test captain for the upcoming England tour, making him the fifth-youngest to hold the position. Rishabh Pant will serve as his deputy. The squad includes fresh faces like B Sai Sudharsan and Arshdeep Singh, alongside Karun Nair's return after eight years.

title: MrBeast net worth hits $1 bn, YouTuber becomes youngest self-made billionaire
content: Jimmy Donaldson, widely recognized as MrBeast, has achieved billionaire status at 27, primarily through his YouTube content. Starting with simple videos, he gained fame for challenges, giveaways, and philanthropy. His business ventures, including Beast Burger and Feastables, alongside strategic content reinvestment, propelled him to become YouTube's most-subscribed creator and a leading philanthropist.

title: 'Like Team India': PM Modi bats for Centre-state unity at Niti Aayog meet
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasised Centre-state collaboration for achieving 'Viksit Bharat@2047' during the NITI Aayog meeting, urging states to develop world-class tourist destinations and future-ready cities. Andhra Pradesh CM proposed sub-groups focusing on GDP growth, population management, and technology-based governance. Several CMs, including those from West Bengal, Kerala and Puducherry, were absent from the meeting.

title: Savannah James shares glimpse of son Bryce James’ convocation
content: Bryce James, son of LeBron and Savannah James, celebrated his graduation from Sierra Canyon School, marking a significant milestone before joining the University of Arizona's basketball team. Savannah shared heartfelt photos and videos from the convocation ceremony, expressing immense pride and excitement for Bryce's future endeavors. The family, including LeBron and siblings Bronny and Zhuri, joined in the celebration.

title: From anxiety to fatigue: How climate change is affecting mental health
content: Climate change is not only causing environmental damage but also significantly impacting mental health, leading to eco-anxiety and ecological grief, especially among younger generations. Experts emphasize the need for integrated care models and increased awareness to address climate-related distress. Recognizing eco-anxiety as a valid concern and promoting emotional resilience are crucial for holistic climate action.

title: Where to watch Calder Cup playoff: Charlotte Checkers, Laval Rocket stand out
content: The 2025 Calder Cup playoffs are intensifying, with the Charlotte Checkers and Laval Rocket emerging as strong contenders. The Checkers impressively swept the Hershey Bears, while the Rocket face a crucial Game 5 against the Rochester Americans. Tight series define the playoffs, highlighting parity and determination as key factors, promising an unforgettable climax.

title: ‘Yachna nahin ...’: How Army delivered bold message post Op Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam massacre, Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, decimating nine terrorist hotspots in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The operation, named by Prime Minister Modi, showcased India's military prowess through videos set to powerful music and verses. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised the operation's swift dismantling of terrorist infrastructure in just 23 minutes.

title: Taylor Swift turns on Blake Lively? Wished 'she never met...'
content: Taylor Swift reportedly regrets her friendship with Blake Lively due to the stress caused by Justin Baldoni's $400 million lawsuit against Lively and Ryan Reynolds. Swift's camp denied her involvement, while Travis Kelce unfollowed Reynolds, signaling support. The legal battle and alleged misuse of Swift's name led to a permanent rift, with Swift prioritizing peace over the alliance.

title: 'Harming Cong': BJP slams Jairam Ramesh's 6 posers on Niti Aayog meet
content: BJP criticised Jairam Ramesh for calling NITI Aayog an "Ayogya" body, claiming such remarks would harm the Congress. Syed Shahnawaz Hussain emphasised NITI Aayog's role in national development, highlighting the participation of chief ministers and eminent individuals in policy-making. He also criticised Rahul Gandhi's delayed visit to Kashmir and his alleged political activities in Bihar.

title: Shubman Gill: A generational talent to lead India's NextGen in Test cricket
content: The sudden Test retirements of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma left a big leadership vacuum in the Indian cricket team and the selectors have backed Shubman Gill for the job. The 25-year-old has led India in five T20Is, Punjab and India A in a handful of matches, and has also been leading Gujarat Titans for the past two seasons. The leadership challenge in the whites is going to be a different ball game, though, and Gill will have his task cut out during the English summer. Those who have seen him grow, evolve, learn and dominate from U-16 days feel he is the right choice!

title: Woman who avoided sunlight...: Signs of dangerous Vitamin D deficiency
content: A 48-year-old Chinese woman suffered a fracture while turning in bed due to severe osteoporosis, stemming from lifelong sun avoidance. Her fear of tanning led to critically low Vitamin D levels, hindering calcium absorption and weakening her bones. This case highlights the importance of sunlight for Vitamin D synthesis and bone health, cautioning against extreme sun protection measures.

title: Just 17 days after meeting 'Danish', YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra travelled to Pakistan
content: Travel blogger Jyoti Malhotra, known as Travel with Joe, faces espionage charges for Pakistan, raising concerns due to her extensive international travel. Records show visits to Dubai, Kathmandu, and Kashmir in January, followed by Pakistan in March and Indonesia in May.

title: Pipe assault, rat poison suicide bid: Chilling details of Hagawane death case
content: Rajendra Hagawane, an expelled NCP functionary, and his son Sushil were apprehended in Swargate after a week-long search following the alleged suicide of Vaishnavi Hagawane. Police teams had been actively pursuing them since the incident on May 16 in Bhukum. A court has remanded both into custody until May 28 for further investigation.

title: Gujarat ATS arrests man for sharing sensitive info with Pakistani spy
content: In Gujarat's Kutch district, the Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) apprehended Sahdevsinh Gohil, a contractual health worker, for allegedly sharing sensitive information about Indian military establishments with a Pakistani spy. Gohil, lured by an agent posing as Aditi Bharadwaj, reportedly sent photos and videos of BSF and Indian Navy facilities via WhatsApp in exchange for money.

title: 'Broken homes, moist eyes': Rahul Gandhi visits Pak shelling-hit Poonch in J&K
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited Poonch, J&K, to meet civilians affected by cross-border shelling from Pakistan. He assured residents he would raise their concerns nationally, emphasizing the strength and dignity they displayed amidst the conflict. Gandhi also visited a school and a damaged Gurudwara, encouraging students and expressing solidarity. The J&K government has announced compensation for the affected families.

title: Watch: NASA's Curiosity rover sends immersive landscape’s video of Mars
content: NASA's Curiosity rover has captured a stunning panoramic video from Mars, revealing an Earth-like landscape within Gale Crater. The rover is currently exploring a sulfate-rich region, offering insights into Mars' past when water was abundant. Curiosity's journey, spanning over 352 million miles, recently uncovered pure elemental sulfur, sparking further questions about the planet's potential for past life.

title: After emergency talks, Yunus to stay on as B'desh interim chief: Report
content: Amidst political turmoil and military pressure, Bangladesh's interim chief Muhammad Yunus will remain in office, confirmed by his advisers after a closed-door meeting. Despite considering resignation due to rising tensions and demands for election clarity, Yunus is set to meet with BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami leaders.

title: Karun Nair's emotional Test return after nearly 3000 days
content: After a hiatus of over 3000 days, Karun Nair makes a remarkable return to India's Test squad for the upcoming series against England. Despite a prolific domestic season and a historic triple century in 2016, Nair faced prolonged exclusion.  The right-hander was prolific in the 2024–25 domestic season, scoring 863 runs in nine Ranji Trophy matches with four centuries, and 779 runs in eight Vijay Hazare Trophy innings, including five centuries.

title: Travis Kelce shocks Taylor Swift with £80,000 presents after time spent apart
content: Despite their demanding schedules and geographical distance, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce maintain a strong bond. Kelce reportedly spent £80,000 on designer gifts for Swift, including Balenciaga outfits, Louis Vuitton jackets, and Hermès beach bags, ensuring she feels cherished. Sources indicate Kelce's generosity and attention to Swift's style demonstrate their commitment, fueling speculation about their future together.

title: Shreyas Iyer ignored for Tests; Agarkar says 'there's no room for him'
content: Shubman Gill is named captain for the England tour, marking a transitional phase for the Indian Test team, with Rishabh Pant as his deputy. Karun Nair makes a comeback after eight years, while Shreyas Iyer is excluded. B Sai Sudharsan and Arshdeep Singh receive their first Test call-ups. The five-match series against England starts on June 20.

title: 'Suffered skull fracture': Man assaulted by delivery boy; Zepto replies
content: In Bengaluru, a businessman named Shashank S. has accused a Zepto delivery agent, Vishnuvardhan, of physical assault following a dispute over a mismatched delivery address. The incident escalated when Shashank intervened in an argument between the delivery agent and his sister-in-law, resulting in the agent allegedly punching him and causing a skull fracture.

title: Mamata, Vijayan among absent opposition CMs as PM Modi chairs NITI Aayog meet
content: Several opposition-ruled states' chief ministers, including West Bengal, Kerala, Karnataka, and Puducherry, were absent from the Niti Aayog's 10th Governing Council meeting chaired by Prime Minister Modi. The meeting focused on "Viksit Rajya for Viksit Bharat @2047," with Modi emphasizing Centre-state cooperation to achieve national goals and urging states to develop world-class tourist destinations.

title: PM Modi likely to meet kin of Pahalgam attack victim Shubham Dwivedi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to meet the family of Shubham Dwivedi, killed in the Pahalgam terror attack, during his Kanpur visit on May 30, following a request from MP Ramesh Awasthi. The family seeks martyr status for Shubham, who was tragically killed in the attack. They hope the Prime Minister will grant their request, honouring Shubham's memory.

title: IMF in 'constructive discussions' with Pakistan, next review expected soon
content: The IMF is in talks with Pakistan regarding its FY2025-26 budget and economic reforms, aiming for continued support under existing loan arrangements. Discussions focus on revenue enhancement, energy sector reforms, and maintaining a tight monetary policy to control inflation. The IMF emphasizes rebuilding foreign exchange reserves and a flexible exchange rate.

title: BSF foils infiltration attempt in Gujarat, Pakistani intruder neutralised
content: Border Security Force (BSF) successfully neutralized a Pakistani intruder attempting to infiltrate Indian territory in Gujarat's Banaskantha district on Friday night. The intruder disregarded warnings and continued advancing towards the border fence, prompting BSF troops to open fire. This incident occurred amidst heightened security following Pakistan's cross-border activities, including India's Operation Sindoor targeting terror camps.

title: Why Jasprit Bumrah was overlooked for Team India Test captaincy
content: Shubman Gill will lead the Indian cricket team as captain for the upcoming Test series in England. Rishabh Pant has been appointed as the vice-captain. The squad of 18 members was announced by Ajit Agarkar. Jasprit Bumrah may not play all five Tests. India aims to win their first Test series in England since 2007.

title: KEA Karnataka KCET result 2025 out: List of official websites to check results
content: The Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA) has announced the KCET 2025 results on May 24. Over 3.3 lakh candidates appeared for the exam. Scorecards will be available from 2 PM on cetonline.karnataka.gov.in/kea and karresults.nic.in. Counselling is expected to begin in June, involving registration, choice filling, seat allotment, and document verification.

title: 'Don’t want to hear...': NBA Analyst Stephen A. Smith backs NFL's Ryan Clark
content: Stephen A. Smith, an ESPN analyst, addressed the public dispute involving Ryan Clark and Robert Griffin III. The disagreement stemmed from Griffin III's comments on WNBA players Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark. Clark criticized Griffin III, leading to personal attacks. Smith defended Clark, stating that firing him would be unwarranted.

title: Muslim man seen offering namaz at Tirumala sparks row in Andhra Pradesh
content: A video showing a Muslim driver offering namaz in Tirumala, a Hindu pilgrimage town, has sparked controversy. The incident, which occurred near the Purohita Sangham area, has drawn criticism for allegedly violating rules prohibiting non-Hindu religious practices on the Tirumala hills.

title: 'Had conversations with Virat and Rohit': Agarkar breaks silence
content: Ajit Agarkar acknowledges a significant shift in the Indian Test team. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Ravichandran Ashwin's absence creates a void. Shubman Gill is named captain for the England series. Rishabh Pant will be the vice-captain. Kohli communicated his decision in early April. The team is looking forward to the new World Test Championship cycle.

title: Shubman Gill named India's new Test captain ahead of England tour
content: Shubman Gill, 25, has been appointed as India's Test captain, succeeding Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The BCCI announced a new-look squad for the upcoming five-match Test series against England, starting June 20. Gill, who has captaincy experience in T20Is and the IPL, will lead India in the ICC World Test Championship 2025–27 cycle, beginning with the England tour.

title: Noida reports 1st Covid case as woman tests positive after train journey
content: A 55-year-old woman in Noida has tested positive for Covid-19 and is currently under home quarantine, according to officials. The woman had travelled by train on May 14th. Samples from her family members have been collected for testing.

title: From Alcaraz to Gauff, ranking the 2025 French Open top contenders
content: top-ranked Jannik Sinner came off a three-month doping suspension . the men's side have reached a combined eight finals in Slams or 1000-level events in 2025 . aryna Sabalenka, coco Gauff and mirra Andreeva have reached the finals .

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .

title: How playoff pressure is different for Seth Jones, other Panthers without a ring
content: a 4-0 lead gives the Panthers the lead going into the third period . Nate Schmidt is one of seven Panthers on the playoff roster . most of them won the Stanley Cup for the first time in franchise history . he says he doesn't want to be the guy without a one-year free agent .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: Oilers make a statement with 3-0 win in Game 2: Grades, takeaways for both teams
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Dallas Stars 3-0 to tie the series at 1-1 . Stuart Skinner continued to be the most boom-or-bust player in the postseason . he gave up 20 goals and didn't have a save percentage better than .833 .

title: U.S. routs Sweden to reach hockey worlds final
content: the united states beat Sweden 6-2 to advance to the final of the ice hockey world championship . the americans will play either Switzerland or Denmark in the other semifinal . in the final, the U.S. jumped to a 2-0 lead with a dominant display .

title: Betting tips for Timberwolves-Thunder Game 3
content: Oklahoma City Thunder beat Minnesota Timberwolves 2-0 in the Western Conference finals . the Thunder are the favorites to win the NBA Finals, followed by the Indiana Pacers . here are four bets to consider for Saturday night's game .
